choices.text: A positive integer $a$ is given. Baron Munchausen claims that he knows such a positive integer $n$ that if one multiplies $n$ by $a$, the sum of its digits decreases $a$ times. In other words, $S(an) = S(n)/a$, where $S(x)$ denotes the sum of digits of the number $x$.  Find out if what Baron told can be true.
